IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
MVR Statement:

My investigation was recorded on body-worn mobile video recording equipment.

Attachments:

  • Maryland State Police Domestic Violence Supplemental Report and Lethality Screening (MSP 246)

  • Photographs of Erano-White’s arms

  • Written Statements for both parties

Suspect 

Harry Smith White Jr., DOB 12/13/1975, 5’06”, 130 lbs., W/M

2210 Liberty Road, Eldersburg, MD 21784

Suspect Statement:

White Jr. was interviewed at the scene. White Jr. stated that he confronted his wife of eight (8) years, Diana Mercidita Erano-White (DOB 12/14/1988), about several thousands of dollars that she had taken from her account. White Jr. stated that he was applying for a government job, and the background investigation revealed that his wife was sending money to her family in the Philippines since they live together. He added that he is supposed to report anything over $1,500 per month. White Jr. also advised that his wife was commuting with a person via telephone who had a Las Vegas phone number. While his wife was sitting in their vehicle in the parking lot, White Jr. stated that he grabbed her phone, and she then grabbed his phone. White Jr. stated that he also grabbed the keys to the car. He then advised that she went inside the residence and called 911, and he waited outside for police to arrive.   

Victim

Diana Mercidita Erano-White, DOB 12/14/1988, 5’00”, 130 lbs., A/F 

2210 Liberty Road, Eldersburg, Maryland 21784

Victim Statement:

Erano-White was interviewed at the scene. She was identified by her Maryland driver’s license as Diana Mercidita Erano-White (DOB 12/14/1988 A/F). While speaking with Erano-White, she informed me that she and her husband were arguing earlier in the day via telephone. After Erano-White and White Jr. returned from going to her in-law's residence, Erano-White decided to stay in the vehicle for approximately ten (10) minutes. Erano-White advised that he approached her when she was in the vehicle and started accusing her of talking to someone on the phone. Erano-White explained to White Jr. that it was a friend, but he did not believe her and grabbed her phone. Erano-White then advised that he twisted her arms and pushed her into the car, and grabbed the keys so she could not leave. Erano-White did not report having any injuries, but an extremely light mark was observed on her left wrist. When questioned about how the mark got there, she was unsure if it was old or fresh in nature and did not know exactly how it appeared. 

Scene Processing

Photographs were taken of Erano-White’s arms and hands. (Photos do not depict the extremely light mark that was initially observed) 

Narrative

On August 08, 2023, at approximately 2302 hours, I, Trooper First Class Mills #6784, currently assigned to the Maryland State Police Westminster Barrack, was on duty, in uniform, operating marked MSP patrol vehicle: G-31. Sergeant Lantz #1981 and I responded to 2210 Liberty Road, Eldersburg, Carroll County, MD 21784, for a report of a potential domestic in progress. The emergency dispatcher later advised that the female who called 911 was hysterical and could not get much information from her. 

Once I arrived on scene, I observed an Asian female sitting in a sports utility vehicle that was parked in the driveway. The female was determined to be the caller and identified by her Maryland driver’s license as Diana Mercidita Erano-White (DOB 12/14/1988 A/F). I obtained the above statement from Erano-White. While speaking with Erano-White, I also conducted the above scene processing. Erano-White did not report having any injuries, but an extremely light mark was observed on her left wrist. When asked how the mark got there, she could not confirm if the mark was from the incident or prior due to the barely noticeable nature. Erano-White stayed separated for the duration of my investigation by continuing to sit in the sports utility vehicle.  

I next made contact with Erano-White’s husband, who was identified as Harry Smith White Jr. (DOB 12/13/1975). I obtained the above statement. While speaking with White Jr. His demeanor was rational and calm, and he described and demonstrated to me how he grabbed her phone. 

I completed the Maryland State Police Domestic Violence Supplemental Report and Lethality Screening (MSP 246) with Erano-White due to her alleged assault by White Jr. Erano-White screened in as a high danger on the lethality screening by answering “yes” to questions 3,5,6,7. I initiated a call to the Carroll County Domestic Hotline at 0033 hours and spoke with Ema #0010. After basic information was relayed, Erano-White spoke with the counselor. Erano-White was given a Victim Witness pamphlet and was referred to the Commissioner by myself and the counselor. At the conclusion of the investigation, White Jr. packed a bag with necessities and went to his parent's house in Glen Burnie, Maryland, to spend the night.

All events occurred in Carroll County, Maryland.
